references.paper_title: Gemini: A family of highly capable multimodal models
references.reason: This paper introduces the Gemini family of models, representing a significant advancement in multimodal capabilities and serving as a benchmark for the development of future multimodal models.

This paper outlines the technical details of the Qwen model, providing valuable insights into the architecture and training methodologies employed in its development, making it crucial for understanding the advancement of language models.
This paper shows the capabilities of language models as few-shot learners, influencing subsequent research on few-shot learning and model adaptation for new tasks.

references.paper_title: A survey on evaluation of large language models
references.reason: This paper surveys the evaluation of large language models, serving as a comprehensive overview of evaluation methodologies.

references.paper_title: Chatbot arena: An open platform for evaluating llms by human preference
references.reason: This paper provides a methodology and platform for evaluating language models based on human preference.
